Standing over the northern head of Machu Picchu is this mountain, often the backdrop of many photographs of the ruins.
It looks a bit imposing from below and it's a steep and difficult climb, but most people in at least moderate shape should be able to do it in about 45 minutes.
Stone stairs are placed along most of the path, and steel cables are laid to support the steepest sections.
That said, expect to run out of air, and be careful in the steepest sections, especially if there's moisture, because it can become dangerous quickly.
Near the summit there is a tiny cave to cross; it is quite low and narrow.
The sights and wildlife of the Galapagos are best viewed by boat, just as Darwin did in 1835.
More than 60 cruise ships sail the Galapagos waters, with capacities of between 8 and 100 passengers.
Most visitors reserve their place well in advance, as the boats are usually full during the high season.
Be assured that the agent who makes your reservation is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of vessels.
This will ensure that your particular interests or limitations are accommodated on the most appropriate vessel.
Before the arrival of the Spanish in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule, while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) populated central and southern Chile.
The Mapuche were also one of the last Native American groups not to be fully absorbed by Spanish-speaking regulation after Chile's independence.

Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (in the midst of the French War, which left Spain without a functioning central government for two years), it did not gain decisive victory against the Spanish until 1818.
The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country occupying the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti.
The country is home to white sand beaches and mountainous landscapes, as well as the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo.
The island was initially inhabited by the Taino and Galibi, an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE.
A few years after the arrival of European explorers, the Spanish conquerors reduced the Taíno population significantly.
According to Fra Bartolomé de las Casas (Treaty of the Indies), between 1492 and 1498, the Spanish conquerors killed about 100,000 Taínos.
Jardín de la Unión: This space was built as the cloister of a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the only surviving building.
Now it functions as the central square and there is always a lot going on, both day and night.
There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoon and evening there are free concerts, often held in the central gazebo.
Callejón del Beso (Kissing alley) Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters that are the origin of an ancient love legend.
For a few pennies some kids will tell you the story.
Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion, offering kayaking, hiking, shopping, dining and more.
This authentic community is located in Howe Sound, off Vancouver, and is easily accessible by scheduled water taxis that depart from Granville Island in downtown Vancouver.
For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a walk along the Sea to Sky corridor is a must.
Whistler (1.5 hours drive from Vancouver) is expensive, but is recognized for the 2010 Winter Olympics.
In the winter, you can enjoy the best skiing in North America, and in the summer, you can enjoy some real mountain biking.
Permits must be booked in advance, you need a permit to spend the night at Sirena.
Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory and dining accommodations in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer camping only, with no food service.
Parking permits can be reserved directly at the Puerto Jiménez ranger station, but credit cards are not accepted.
The park service (MINAE) does not grant access permits with more than a month's notice of arrival.
Cafet El Sol offers a reservation service for US$30 or $10 for day passes.
The Cook Islands are an island state in free association with New Zealand, and are located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean.
It is an archipelago of 15 islands spread over 2.2 million square kilometers of ocean.
With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes known as the "Hawaii of Oceania".
Although smaller, some of the older visitors are reminded of Hawaii before it became a state, without the big tourist hotels and other construction.
The Cook Islands are a group of 15 islands, the main ones being Rarotonga and Aitutaki.
Today, luxury bed and breakfast in developed countries has become almost an art form.
At the upper end, B&Bs obviously compete mostly on two main things: bed and breakfast.
Consequently, the most luxurious sheets, perhaps a handwoven bathrobe or an antique bed, can be found in these establishments.
Breakfast may include seasonal regional delicacies or the host's specialty.
The stage may be a historic building with antique furniture, well-kept grounds, and a swimming pool.
Getting in your car and taking a long road trip has an inherent appeal in its simplicity.
Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably familiar with your car's operation and its limitations.
Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily draw unwanted attention.
In short, the car is a great option for a road trip, but it is not usually a form of "camping" in itself.
Car camping is feasible if you have a van, sedan, sport utility vehicle or large van with reclining seats.
Some hotels have a legacy from the golden age of steam trains and ocean liners; before World War II, in the 19th century or early 20th century.
These hotels were where the rich and famous of the time stayed, and often had good food and nightlife.
Vintage accessories, lack of modern conveniences and a certain elegant ageing are also part of its character.
Although usually private properties, they sometimes host visits from heads of state and other dignitaries.
A traveler with a lot of money might consider flying around the world, with breaks to stay in many of these hotels.
A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with neighbors in the cities they are visiting.
To join such an atypical network, one generally only needs to fill out a questionnaire, although some networks offer or ask for additional verification.
A list of hosts is then offered either in printed form or online, sometimes with quotes and opinions from other travelers.
Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 when programmer Casey Fenton found a budget flight to Iceland, but had nowhere to stay.
She wrote letters to students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers of free accommodation.
Hostels are usually aimed at a younger audience - a typical host is in his twenties - but often older travellers can be found as well.
Families with children are rare to see, but hotels allow them to stay in private rooms.
The Chinese city of Beijing will be the host city of the 2022 Winter Olympics, making it the first city to have hosted both the Summer and Winter Games.
Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies as well as indoor ice events.
Other skiing events will be held at Taizicheng ski area in Zhangjiakou, about 220 km (140 mi) from Beijing.
Most temples celebrate an annual festival that begins between late November and mid-May, and which varies according to each temple's annual calendar.
Most temple festivals are celebrated as part of the temple's birthday or the birthday of the presiding deity or any other event associated with the temple.
It is very interesting to see the temple festivals of Kerala; there are periodic processions of tamed elephants, a temple orchestra and other festivities.
A World's Fair (often called a World's Fair, or simply an Expo) is a large international arts and science festival.
Participating countries present artistic and educational displays in national pavilions to showcase world issues or their country's culture and history.
International Horticultural Exhibitions are specialized events that display floral displays, botanical gardens, and anything else related to plants.
Although in theory they are held every year (as long as it is in different countries), in practice not.
These events typically last between three and six months, and are held on sites no smaller than 50 hectares.
Over the years many different film formats have been used, the most common by far being standard 35 mm film (36 by 24 mm negatives).
It can generally be rested fairly easily if it runs out, and offers a resolution comparable to current DSLRs.
Some medium format film cameras use a 6 by 6 cm format, more precisely a 56 by 56 mm negative.
This gives us a resolution almost four times that of a 35 mm negative (3.136 mm2 instead of 864).
Wildlife is one of the most challenging subjects for a photographer, and requires a combination of good luck, patience, experience and good equipment.
Wildlife photography is sometimes taken for granted, but like photography in general, a picture is worth a thousand words.
Wildlife photography often requires a long telephoto lens, however, things like a flock of birds or a tiny creature need other lenses.
Many exotic animals are difficult to find, and sometimes parks have rules about commercial photography.
Wild animals can be shy or aggressive, and the environment can be cold, warm, or hostile.
There are over 5,000 different languages in the world, of which more than 20 are spoken by 50 million or more people.
Written words are often easier to understand than spoken words, too. This is especially true for addresses, which are often difficult to pronounce intelligibly.
There are many nations where English is spoken fluently throughout the territory, and in many others you can expect limited knowledge, especially among the youth.
Imagine, please, one from Manchester, one from Boston, one from Jamaica and one from Sydney sitting around a table in a restaurant in Toronto.
They delight each other with stories from their hometowns, told in their different accents and local slang.
Buying food from supermarkets is often the cheapest way to eat, but if you can't cook, your options are limited to precooked food.
Supermarkets are increasingly offering a variety of prepared foods, some even offering a microwave or other means of heating the dishes.
In some countries or types of shops there is at least one restaurant, often rather informal with affordable prices.
Make copies of your policy and the insurance company's contact information, and hang them upstairs.
These must contain insurer data such as e-mail address and telephone numbers to call from abroad and thus obtain indications/authorisations and also make claims.
Keep another copy in your luggage and online (e-mail the attachment to yourself, or save it to the cloud).
If you travel with a laptop or tablet, keep a copy on your hard drive or disk (which can be accessed without the Internet).
Also hand out copies of the policy/contact traveling companions and relatives or friends who are willing to help.
Ants (also known as wasps) are not inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat.
When people don't see ants as potentially dangerous animals, they tend to get too close and, as a result, they can put themselves in danger.
Alcohol affects everyone differently, and it is very important that you know your own limit.

The potential health effects of excessive drinking, in the long term, can include liver damage and even blindness and death. The potential danger is increased when illegally produced alcohol is consumed.
Illegal liquor may contain several dangerous impurities such as methanol, which can cause blindness or death even in small doses.
Glasses can be more economical in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where production costs are lower.
You might consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if your insurance covers it, and taking the prescription with you to fill out elsewhere.
Luxury brand mounts available in these areas can have two problems: some may be imitations, and the really imported ones may be more expensive than not at home.
Coffee is one of the world's most traded commodities, and you may find many varieties in your area.
Still, there are many different ways of drinking coffee around the globe that are worth trying.
Canyoning is the practice of reaching the bottom of a canyon, which may be dry or filled with water.

Canyoning combines elements of swimming, climbing, and jumping, but requires relatively little training or fitness to begin with (compared to mountain climbing, scuba diving, or alpine skiing, for example).
Hiking is an outdoor activity consisting of walking in natural environments, often along hiking trails.
Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile to longer distances that can be done in a single day.
A day trip on a simple trail requires little preparation, and anyone in moderate shape can join.
Families with young children may need more preparation, but a day outdoors is easily achievable with infants or preschoolers.
Internationally, there are almost 200 tourism organizations in operation. Most of these operate independently.
Global Running Tours' successor, Go Running Tours, connects dozens of outdoor running suppliers across four continents.
With roots in Barcelona's Running Tours Barcelona and Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, they were quickly joined by Prague-based Running Tours Prague and others.
There are many things you have to have in mind before and during a trip to any place.
When traveling, do not expect things to be "like at home". The fashions, laws, food, traffic, accommodations, standards, language, and so forth will be somewhat different from where you live.
This is something that should always be kept in mind, to avoid disappointment or perhaps even dislike of local ways of doing things.

Travel agencies have existed since the 19th century, and a travel agent is usually a good option for a trip that goes beyond the previous experience of travel with nature, culture, language or low-income countries.
While most agencies are willing to accept more general bookings, many specialize in certain specific types of trips, budget ranges, or destinations.
It may be convenient to use an agent who often book similar trips to yours.
Take a look at the travel agent's listings, either on the website or in the office window.
If you want to see a world with little money, whether it's for need, lifestyle or challenge, there are a number of ways to do it.
This article focuses on the latter, which is to say, either you work while you travel or you try to limit your expenses.
For those willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability to bring costs down to near zero, see travel with minimal budget.
The council assumes that travelers do not steal, or transgress, or participate in the illegal market, or beg, or exploit other people for their own gain.
Normally, the first stop after disembarking from a plane, ship, or other vehicle is an immigration checkpoint.
Some cross-border trains are checked while the train is in motion and you must have a valid identity document when you board one.
The driver can collect passports on night trains so as not to interrupt sleep.
Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process.In some countries, you must register your presence and address with the local authorities.
To do so, you may need to fill out a form with the local police or visit immigration offices.
In many countries with a law like this, local hotels will handle the registration (be sure to ask).
In other cases, only those who do not stay in tourist accommodation must be registered, but this makes the law much more obscure, so it is necessary to find out in advance.
Architecture is the design and construction of buildings. The architecture of a place is usually a tourist attraction in itself.
Many buildings are beautiful enough to see, and the view from a tall building or from a well-placed window can be a delight.
Architecture coincides significantly with other fields such as urban planning, civil engineering, decorative arts, interior design and landscape design.
Given the great distance to many of the "pueblos", you won't find much nightlife unless you visit Albuquerque or Santa Fe.
However, almost all of the above-mentioned casinos serve drinks, and many of them offer first-class entertainment (especially the larger ones, around Albuquerque and Santa Fe).
Be aware: the bars in small towns around here are not always a good place for visitors from other states.
For some reason, northern New Mexico has significant problems with drunk drivers, and the concentration of drunk drivers is high near the bars in small towns.
Graffiti is a form of art that is created without being asked to do so.
While not at all a modern phenomenon, most people associate it with young people vandalizing public and private property using spray paint.
However, today there are renowned artists, graffiti-related events and "legal" walls. Graffiti works in this context often have more artwork than illegible gutters.
Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists look to learn.
If you want to learn how to throw a boomerang that comes back to you, make sure you have one of those boomerangs.
Most boomerangs available in Australia are, in fact, boomerangs that don't come back.
A Hangi meal is cooked in a hot clot on the ground.
The clot is heated with hot stones from a fire or in some places geothermal heat creates areas of naturally warm earth.
Hangi is often used to cook a roasted meal in the traditional manner.
Many places in Rotorua offer geothermal hangi, while other hangi can be taken in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.
MetroRail has two classes of suburban trains in and around Cape Town: MetroPlus (also called First Class) and Metro (Third Class).
MetroPlus is more comfortable and less crowded, but is a bit more expensive, though still cheaper than normal metro tickets in Europe.
All trains have Metro and MetroPlus cars; MetroPlus cars are always at the end of the train closest to Cape Town.
Carrying other people's things - Never lose sight of your bags, especially when crossing international borders.
You can find yourself being used as drug runners without knowing it, which would bring you a lot of trouble.
This includes waiting in line, as drug-sniffing dogs could be used at any time without warning.
Some countries have excessively severe punishments even for first offenses; they may involve prison sentences of more than ten years or death.
Unchecked suitcases are a target for thieves and can also call the attention of cautious authorities with bomb threats.
At home, because of this constant exposure to the local germs, it's very likely that you're already immune to them.
But in places around the world where the bacterial fauna is new to you, you're much more likely to have problems.
Also, in warmer climates bacteria grow faster and survive longer outside the body.
From here come traveler's diaries such as "the stomach of Delhi", "the curse of the pharaoh", "the revenge of Moctezuma" and many other variants.
As with respiratory problems in cold climates, intestinal problems in warm climates are quite common and in most cases are annoying but not really dangerous.
If you're traveling to a developing country (or a new part of the world) for the first time, don't underestimate the potential for culture shock.
Many seasoned and experienced travelers have been overtaken by the new when traveling to developing countries, where there are many small cultural adjustments that accumulate quickly.
Especially in your first few days, consider spending money on Western-style, quality hotels, food, and services to help you acclimate.
Don't sleep on a mattress or stool in the ground in an area where you don't know the local wildlife.
If you plan to camp outdoors, bring a camping cot or hammock to keep away from snakes, scorpions, and other similar wildlife.
Fill your house with a rich coffee in the morning and a little relaxing chamomile in the evening.
When you're at your vacation home, you have time to enjoy and spend a few extra minutes preparing something special.
If you are feeling adventurous, do not miss the opportunity to squeeze or mix some fruit juices:
Maybe you'll discover a simple drink that you can make for breakfast when you return to your usual routine.
If you live in a city with a diverse drinking culture, go to bars or pubs in neighborhoods you don't normally visit.
For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have different meanings.
An infectious disease is one caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus, or other parasite.
A contagious disease is a disease that is easily transmitted when you are near an infected person.
Many governments require that visitors entering or residents leaving their countries be vaccinated for a number of diseases.
Often these requirements depend on the countries the traveler has previously visited or intends to visit.
One of the strengths of Charlotte, North Carolina, is its high number of high-quality options for families.
Residents from other areas often cite family-friendliness as the main reason for moving here, and visitors often find it easy to enjoy the city with children.
In the last 20 years the number of kid-friendly options in Uptown Charlotte has increased exponentially.
Families do not often use taxis in Charlotte, although they may be useful in certain cases.
There is a surcharge for having more than two passengers, so this option can be more expensive than the account.
Antarctica is the coldest place on Earth, and it surrounds the South Pole.
Tourist visits are expensive, require good fitness, and can only be done in the summer, between November and February, and are very limited to the peninsula, islands and the Ross Sea.
A couple of thousand employees live here during the summer in about four dozen bases mostly in those areas; a small number stay over the winter.
The interior of Antarctica is a desolate plateau covered by 2 to 3 km of ice.
Occasionally there are specialized air routes that go inland, to practice mountaineering or to reach the Pole, where there is a very large base.
The South Pole Crossing (or Highway) is a 1,600 km (1,600 mi) trail from McMurdo Station on the Ross Sea to the Pole.
It is snow compacted with cracks filled and marked with flags, and can only be crossed by specialized tractors, which tow sleds with fuel and supplies.
They are not very agile, so the trail has to make a long journey around the Transantarctic Mountains to reach the plateau.
The most common causes of accidents in winter are roads, pavements (walkways) and especially slippery steps.
Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow, even some winter boots are deficient.
The pattern should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inches) or more, and the material soft enough in cold temperatures.
Some boots have heels and there are accessories with heels for slippery conditions, suitable for most shoes or boots, for the heels or for the sole and heel.
Heels should be low and wide, and roads are often sprayed with sand, gravel, or salt (calcium chloride) to improve traction.
Avalanches are not an extraordinary occurrence; the steep slopes only admit a certain amount of snow, and an excess volume precipitates in the form of avalanches.
The problem is that snow is sticky, so it needs a push to get down, and a little bit of snow that falls can be used as a push for the rest.
Sometimes the triggering event is the sun heating the snow, sometimes it's more snow, sometimes other natural events, often a human.
A tornado is a rotating column of air at very low pressure, which sucks the surrounding air inward and upward.
They generate strong winds (often 100-200 miles per hour) and can lift heavy objects upwards, carrying them as the tornado moves.
They start as plumes that descend from storm clouds, and become tornadoes when they hit the ground.
Providers of personal VPNs (virtual private networks) are an excellent way to avoid both political censorship and commercial IP geo-filtering.
These are better than web proxies for several reasons: for example, they do not just redirect http but do so with all internet traffic.
They tend to offer higher bandwidth and better service quality, and they're encrypted, so they're harder to spy on.
The media companies lie again and again about the purpose of this action, claiming that it is to "prevent piracy".
In fact, area codes have no effect on illegal copies; a bit-for-bit copy of a disk plays just as well on any device that can play the original.
The current purpose is to offer these companies more control over their markets; it's about making money.
Since calls are routed through the Internet, you do not need to have a telephone company located where you live or where you travel.

You don't need a local number in your community either; you can get a satellite Internet connection in the most desolate areas of Chicken, Alaska and dial a number that says you're under the Arizona sun.
Often, you have to buy a separate global number to allow XTC phones to call you. The origin of the phone number makes a difference to the people who call you.
Real-time text translation applications - applications that can automatically translate fragments of entire text from one language to another.
Some applications within this category can even translate text in foreign languages on signs or other real-world objects when the user directs the smartphone to these objects.

Translation engines have improved dramatically, and nowadays they tend to offer more or less correct translations (and fewer and fewer gibberish), but always be careful, because they can still be wrong.
One of the most prominent applications in this category is Google Translate, which allows offline translation once the data of the desired language has been downloaded.
Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone may be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate outside your home country.
You can save money by buying new maps for a GPS or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a rental car company.
If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or if you lack coverage, your performance may be limited or zero.
All grocery stores have a confusing array of prepaid phone cards that can be used for both pay phones and regular phones.
Although most cards are valid for calling anywhere, some specialize in offering convenient calling rates to groups of specific countries.
These services are usually accessed through a toll-free telephone number that can be called from most phones without having to pay.
The rules about normal photography also apply to video recording, even more so.
If the mere act of taking a picture of something is forbidden, the idea of making a video of it must be put out of your mind.
Before using a drone, make sure you are cleared to record and what additional permits or licenses you need.
Flying a drone near an airport or over a crowd is almost always a bad idea, even if it's not illegal in your area.
Nowadays, it is very unusual to book flights directly with the airline, without searching and comparing prices beforehand.
Sometimes the same flight can have very variable prices on different content readers and it pays to compare search results and to take a look at the website of the company itself before booking.

While you may not need a visa for short visits, for tourism or business to certain countries, going there as an international student usually requires a longer stay than going there as an occasional tourist.
You usually need to obtain a visa in advance to stay in any foreign country for an extended period.
Student visas usually require different requirements and application procedures than normal tourist or business visas.
For most countries, you need a letter of offer from the institution you want to study at, and also proof of sufficient resources to support yourself for at least your first year of study.
Check the specific requirements with the institution and with the immigration department of the country where you wish to study.
Unless you are a diplomat, working abroad usually involves paying income taxes in the country where you reside.
Income tax is structured differently in different countries, and tax rates and subsidies vary quite a bit from one country to another.
In some federal countries, as well as the United States and Canada, income tax is levied at both the federal and local levels, so rates and supports may vary from one region to another.
Although immigration control is usually absent or a formality when you return to your home country, customs control can be a nuisance.
Make sure you know what you can and cannot carry, and report anything that exceeds the legal limit.
The easiest way to get started in the travel writing business is to polish your craft on a well-established travel blog.
Once you have become familiar with the format and editing of the website, then you can create your own site.
Volunteering while traveling is a great way to make a difference, but it's not just about giving.
Living and volunteering in a foreign country is a great way to get to know a different culture, meet new people, learn about yourself, get a sense of perspective and even gain new skills.
It can also be a good way to stretch a budget to be able to extend the stay somewhere, since many volunteer jobs are offered with full pension and some are paid a small salary.
The Vikings used Russian waterways to reach the Black Sea and the Caspian Sea. Parts of these routes can still be used. Check possible special permit requirements, which can be difficult to obtain.
The White Sea-Baltic Sea channel links the Arctic Ocean to the Baltic Sea, via Lake Onega, Lake Ladoga and St. Petersburg, mostly via rivers and lakes.
Lake Onega is also connected to the Volga, so you can still reach the Caspian Sea through Russia.
You can be sure that once you enter the marina, it will be very obvious, you will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you.
Basically, you'll be putting up ads offering your help, walking around the cabinets, approaching people who are cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors at the bar, and so on.
Try to talk to as many people as you can, and after a while, everyone will know you and they'll let you know and they'll give you advice like what boat someone's looking for.
You should choose your Frequent Traveler companion carefully in an alliance.

While it may seem logical to join the airline with which you fly most often, it is important to keep in mind that the privileges they offer are often different and that other airlines within the same alliance may give you more frequent flyer points.

Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways and Turkish Airlines have significantly increased their services to Africa, and offer connections to most major African cities at more competitive prices than other European companies.
Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries as of 2014.
If you have time to spare for travel, calculate how much it costs you in total to travel to Africa compared with a round-the-world trip.
Don't forget to count the extra expenses of additional visas, travel fees, ground transportation, etc. for all places outside Africa.
If you want to fly around the world entirely over the southern hemisphere, flight options and destinations are limited by the lack of trans-oceanic routes.
There is no air alliance that crosses all three oceans of the southern hemisphere (and Skyteam does not cover any of the three).
However, Star Alliance covers all but the South Pacific from Santiago de Chile to Tahiti, which is a LATAM Oneworld flight.
This flight is not the only option if you want to avoid the South Pacific and the west coast of South America. (See below)
In 1994, the ethnic Armenian region of Nagorno-Karabakh in Azerbaijan went to war against the Azeris.
With the support of the Armenians, a new republic was created, yet no established nation has officially recognized it - not even Armenia.
Diplomatic discussions over the region continue to undermine the relationship between Armenia and Azerbaijan.
The Canal District (Grachtengordel in Dutch) is the famous 17th-century neighbourhood surrounding Amsterdam's Binnenstad.
The entire neighborhood has been designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its unique historical and cultural value, and the value of its properties is among the highest in the country.
The Cinque Terre, meaning Five Lands, comprise the five coastal towns of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso, located in the Italian region of Liguria.
They are included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.
Over the centuries, people have carefully built rows of houses back to back across the rugged, steep landscape to the cliffs that face the sea.
Part of its charm is the lack of human construction, with roads, trains and boats connecting the villages and cars unable to reach them.
The varieties of French spoken in Belgium and Switzerland are slightly different from the French spoken in France, but are sufficiently similar to be mutually intelligible.

Specifically, the numbering system in the French-speaking territories of Belgium and Switzerland has a number of small peculiarities that differentiate it from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of certain words is a bit different.
However, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned French in school, so they would be able to understand it even if the standard French numbering system was used.
In many parts of the world, a handshake is a friendly gesture that means "hello".

Now, in Malaysia, at least among rural Malays, it means "come here", similar to the gesture of the index finger pointing to one's own body used in some Western countries, and should only be used for that purpose.
Similarly, a British traveler to Spain may confuse a hand-palm greeting by looking at the sender (rather than the person receiving the greeting) with a gesture to go back.
Auxiliary languages are artificial or constructed languages created with the aim of facilitating communication between people who otherwise would have communication difficulties.
These are separate from the Franks, which are natural or organic languages that, for various reasons, acquire dominance as a means of communication between speakers of other languages.
Travelers can see mirages that generate an illusion of water (or other things) with the daytime heat.
This can be dangerous if the traveler chases the mirage, wasting precious energy and remaining water.
Even the hottest desert can become extremely cold at night. Hypothermia is a real risk without clothing to shelter.
Especially in the summer, you should be on the lookout for mosquitoes if you decide to make a trek through the rainforest.
Even if you're driving through the subtropical rainforest, a few seconds with the doors open as you enter the vehicle is enough for the mosquitoes to get in with you.
Avian influenza, or more formally avian influenza, can infect birds and mammals.
Fewer than a thousand cases have been reported in humans, but some have been fatal.
In most cases, this is people working with poultry, but there is also a certain risk for bird watchers.
Typical of Norway are the steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a plateau, more or less high.
These plateaus are often called "vides", which means spaces with breadth, open and without trees, that is, an unlimited extension.
In Rogaland and Agder they are often called "hei", which refers to a woodless wasteland often covered with caterpillars.
Glaciers are not stable, but they flow down the mountain, and this will cause cracks, fissures, that can be hidden by snow dams.
The walls and ceilings of the ice caves may sink and the crevasses may close.
On the edges of glaciers are large blocks that break, fall, and sometimes jump or roll off the edge.
The tourist season of the hill stations usually peaks during the Indian summer.
However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm in winter, when many mountain resorts receive large amounts of snow and offer activities such as skiing or snowboarding.
Few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly reduce the cost of a last-minute funeral trip.
Companies that offer this include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating in the US or Canada, and WestJet.
In any case, you must make a reservation by telephone directly with the airline.
